Mr. Lowell Thomas Jr., shows a baby koala to his son David at the Lone Pine Sanctuary in Brisbane, Australia. Mr. Thomas recently toured the South Pacific to gather material for a series of movie illustrated travel lectures which he will present coast-to-coast in the U.S. and Canada this coming October and November. Mr. Thomas and family visited Australia, New Zealand, Tahiti, Fiji, New Caledonia, Western Samoa and American Samoa

Note: Mr. Lowell Thomas Jr., shows a baby koala to his son David at the Lone Pine Sanctuary in Brisbane, Australia. Mr. Thomas recently toured the South Pacific to gather material for a series of movie illustrated travel lectures which he will present coast-to-coast in the U.S. and Canada this coming October and November. Mr. Thomas and family visited Australia, New Zealand, Tahiti, Fiji, New Caledonia, Western Samoa and American Samoa

Anne Thomas
Verso: Anne Thomas
Lowell Thomas, Jr.: Thomas, Jr. family [includes color photographs]
Caption: Our bedroom - green, gold and white. The kids' room's a mess!
Caption: Our kitchen alcove with family room beyond
Caption: Family room-fireplace will have Dutch tiles
Caption: We caught David asleep last night with his favorite pilot cap on!
Caption: living room, Dining end- entire wall to right is glass, gold sconces on top of cupboard will go on wall over sideboard. This is big old couch from playroom reupholstered in gold wool
Caption: Living room (pale yellow walls)
Caption: L.T.'s walnut paneled study-little door goes to furnace + storage (kids making faces!)
Caption: L.T's study opposite end-we built in book shelves on right wall-more faces!
[Anne and David]
[Anne and David with Lowell Thomas and Frances Ryan Thomas]

Note: July 25; Hi! Some pictures I thought you'd like to have (have sent copies to mother, too). Perhaps Sally would like to see them - many thanks for the new Bible-quite a change! Look forward to reading it. Life hectic, as usual. Am trying to get lots done around the house while Lowell is in California. We're all well-the children swimming like fish now-also enjoying the woods and stream-haven't worn my shoes for weeks! Lots of love, Tay
Caption: The Arctic Valley ski area
Caption: Look what Lowell caught! Lake Nancy - June 1961
Caption: View from living room at 10 p.m. Mt. Mckinley behind clouds. Window on right covers most of wall
Caption: Florida - April - 1961 [From left to right: Lowell Thomas, Frances Ryan Thomas, Tay Thomas, Jr. with her children Anne and David]
Caption: Lower level: L.T.s study - Large windows: living room; Will put lawn in her in August - also ferns and juniper against house [Tay Thomas, Jr. with children Anne and David]
Caption: The red did not reproduce well - it's a lovely "New England barn red" ; Begonias [David and Anne Thomas, Jr.]
Caption: terrace will be on right - white sweet peas now cover trellis!
Caption: July 4, 1961; From road - flowers not up yet. To come: shrubbery, window boxes, shingles, terrace; garage
Caption: July 4th - weekend - camping in the Chugach [Lowell Thomas, Jr.]
Caption: Our new "front yard" - Mts. behind clouds [Tay Thomas, Jr. with children Anne and David]
Caption: Daddy teaching the rudiments of rock climbing [Lowell Thomas, Jr. with children Anne and David]
Caption: More fishermen - Anne is an avid one - will spend several very patient hours at it [David and Anne Thomas, Jr.]
Caption: Arctic Valley ski area - January 1961
[Lowell Thomas and Frances Ryan Thomas on right]

Lowell Thomas, Jr.: Thomas, Jr. family - Christmas cards [includes color photographs]

[Christmas card 1] Caption: May the Spirit of Christmas be with you throughout the New Year [and written:] And our love, Tay + Lowell Thomas, Belated greetings due to a trip to New England Where we found more snow than in Alaska!
[inside of christmas card 1] Caption: Dave skates on the lake behind our home
[inside of christmas card 1] Caption: Anne competes in Junior National Cross Country race
[Christmas card 2] Note: Peace be in thy home, And in thy heart, Or if thou roam Earth's highways wide, The Lord be at the side To bless and guide - Anonymous
[Inside of second christmas card 2] Caption: Merry Christmas July '70; And our love, Lowell + Tay Thomas, Anne + Dave
Note: envelope from Lowell Thomas, Jr.'s family to Mrs. Lynn Sumner in Quaker Hill, Pawling, NY
[Cover of christmas card 3] Caption: Merry Christmas! Come look out our window
[Inside of christmas card 3] Caption: Alaska in Summer
[Inside of christmas card 3] Caption: Alaska in Winter
[Back of christmas card 3] Caption: hot or cold, a warm welcome to all in our new home - Lowell + Tay Thomas
[Christmas card 4] Caption: Daddy on the Dew Line; Mommy at the clothes line; We on the Flight line; Flying Christmas Greetings to You - Lowell, Tay, Anne and David Thomas
Note: envelope addressed to Mrs. Lynn Sumner in Quaker Hill, Pawling, NY
[Christmas card 5] Caption: Peace on Earth [12 copies]

Barbara Britch, U.S. Junior National champ (a senior at one of our local high schools) and Anne. Barbara hopes to go to Middlebury next year. Anne wants to go to Dartmouth - she says it will be co-ed by then! The 2 Canadian girl whizzes are in the background - 15 year old twin sisters

Verso: Barbara Britch, U.S. Junior National champ (a senior at one of our local high schools) and Anne. Barbara hopes to go to Middlebury next year. Anne wants to go to Dartmouth - she says it will be co-ed by then! The 2 Canadian girl whizzes are in the background - 15 year old twin sisters
Members of Alaska's Nordic team - 9 girls and 12 boys. Anne is standing fourth from left

"Ready to try their wings" - this group of 230 Army Aviation Cadets from the Boston Aviation Cadet Examining Board is due to "take off" for pre-flight training at Nashville, Tenn. Today. In front are Major Edward H. Holterman, left, Army Air Corps, and Ralph H. Welles, Army Medical Corps

Note: physical note containing captions for photographs 1-30
Lowell Thomas, Jr.: Ahmet Sayin (Turkey)

Note: Letter from Ahmet Sayin: Dear Mr. Thomas, Please excuse my being late to write to you as it has been difficult for me to find somebody to translate my letter into English. I am sendig you three photographs as a souvenir of our friendship during your short stay in our country. Hoping that your keeping well and I shall hear from you soon, I remain, Sincerely yours, [signed] A. Sayin

Uniform prescribed for Lieut. Ernest Blake, USN., the Admiral's aid, who had not been across the "Line" before. He was forced to stand on the bow of the ship "reporting" everything he saw and the progress of King Neptune etc. for some two hours. Lieut. Blake is to the left a sailor to the right in picture
